snippet: The administration’s proposal would extend a billion-dollar package of loans from the International Monetary Fund to $1.6 billion by expanding loan limits for countries like Ukraine.
abstract: House Republicans have rebuffed Pres Obama's request to extend $1 billion aid package for Ukrainian government to $1.6 billion by expanding International Monetary Fund loan limits; House, Senate and White House negotiators are expected to square off over proposal if it remains in draft plan.
lead_paragraph: The administration’s proposal would extend a billion-dollar package of loans from the International Monetary Fund to $1.6 billion by expanding loan limits for countries like Ukraine.

headline.main: House Republicans Balk at Wording in Obama Emergency Aid Package for Ukraine
headline.print_headline: House Republicans Balk at Wording in Obama Emergency Aid Package
